pr_title: Allow traces to be reported if continuations are GC'd before activation.

timeline.message:
Allow traces to be reported if continuations are GC'd before activation.

Split up tracking between spans and continuations for better logging.
Restructure the logs for better consistency.

timeline.author: tylerbenson

timeline.bodyText: Instead of using a second reference queue, could we write the trace when all spans are finished?
timeline.author: devinsba

replies.bodyText: Yes, that would be simpler.  That's effectively our current semantic guarantee anyway.
replies.author: dougqh

replies.bodyText: The problem is, we may have spans added to an existing trace even after all other spans are complete.
replies.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: I know this is already merged but I don't think that any spans that start after the root span tree has finished should semantically block reporting of the trace. Its possible there are cases that this isn't true, queue consumption maybe, but I think in the case of http/rpc once the root span tree is finished we should be ok to report
replies.author: devinsba
